name: Djibouti
description: Djibouti, a small, arid nation located in the Horn of Africa, is a strategically important country with a unique blend of desert landscapes, coastal plains, and volcanic mountains. It’s a land of dramatic contrasts, hosting diverse ecosystems and playing a crucial role in regional trade and security.  Historically a crossroads for caravan routes, Djibouti today is a burgeoning hub for shipping and logistics, and a vital conservation area for migratory birds.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: The bustling capital and economic center of Djibouti.
quickFacts.detail: Djibouti City is a rapidly developing urban area, characterized by modern infrastructure and a growing population.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: Djibouti's population is primarily comprised of Afar, Somali, and Arab communities.
quickFacts.detail: The majority of the population resides in Djibouti City and surrounding areas.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: Djibouti is one of the smallest countries in Africa.
quickFacts.detail: Its land area is largely desert, with limited arable land.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.description: French is widely used in government and education, while Arabic is prevalent in religious and cultural contexts.
quickFacts.detail: Somali is also spoken by a significant portion of the population.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.detail: DJF is pegged to the Euro.

quickFacts.label: GDP
quickFacts.description: Djibouti's economy is heavily reliant on port services and logistics.
quickFacts.detail: Key sectors include shipping, telecommunications, and tourism.

climateData.title: Climate of Djibouti
climateData.description: Djibouti experiences a hot desert climate with extremely high temperatures and very little rainfall. The coastal areas are slightly cooler due to the influence of the Indian Ocean, but overall, the climate is harsh and arid.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (June - August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Summer is characterized by scorching heat and intense sunshine. Rainfall is minimal, and temperatures frequently exceed 40°C (104°F).

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Autumn (September - November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Autumn brings a slight decrease in temperature and a slightly increased chance of rain, though rainfall remains scarce. The days are still long and sunny.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter (December - February)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Winter is the coolest time of year, with average daytime temperatures around 20-25°C (68-77°F). Rainfall is slightly more frequent, but still limited.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring (March - May)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Spring sees a gradual warming trend and a slight increase in rainfall. The landscape begins to show signs of renewed life.

naturalWonders.name: Lake Assal
naturalWonders.description: Lake Assal is the lowest point in Africa, a vast, saline lake surrounded by volcanic mountains. Its unique ecosystem supports specialized plant and animal life, adapted to the harsh conditions.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The lake's high salinity is due to volcanic activity and evaporation. It's a remarkable geological feature and a popular tourist destination.

naturalWonders.name: Mount Haggar (Gare Allah)
naturalWonders.description: Mount Haggar is a dramatic volcanic plateau, the highest point in Djibouti, offering a surreal and otherworldly landscape. It’s a testament to the country’s volcanic past.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The plateau is a vast expanse of salt crust, surrounded by towering volcanic mountains. It’s a challenging but rewarding destination for experienced hikers.
viewingTips: Bring plenty of water and food

naturalWonders.name: Markha National Park
naturalWonders.description: Markha National Park is a protected area encompassing a diverse range of habitats, including mountains, grasslands, and acacia woodlands. It’s a crucial refuge for wildlife and a vital part of Djibouti’s biodiversity.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The park is home to a variety of endemic species, including gazelles, vultures, and reptiles. It’s an important area for conservation and ecotourism.

biodiversityCategory.name: Birds
biodiversityCategory.description: Djibouti is a critical stopover point for migratory birds traveling between Africa and Eurasia, making it a haven for avian diversity.

statistics.details: These birds rely on Djibouti's wetlands and coastal areas for rest and refueling.
Djibouti is home to several bird species found nowhere else on Earth.

notableSpecies.name: White-throated Raven
notableSpecies.significance: A highly specialized bird adapted to the harsh desert environment.

notableSpecies.name: Sooty Falcon
notableSpecies.significance: A long-distance migrant that relies on Djibouti as a crucial stopover.

ecosystemData.title: Ecosystems of Djibouti
ecosystemData.overview: Djibouti’s ecosystems are remarkably diverse, ranging from arid deserts and salt lakes to coastal wetlands and mountainous regions. These ecosystems support a unique array of plant and animal life, many of which are endemic to the country.

biodiversityCategories.name: Birds
biodiversityCategories.description: Djibouti is a critical stopover point for migratory birds, supporting a rich avian diversity.

statistics.details: These birds rely on Djibouti's wetlands and coastal areas for rest and refueling.

notableSpecies.name: White-throated Raven
notableSpecies.significance: A highly specialized bird adapted to the harsh desert environment.

biodiversityCategories.name: Desert Flora
biodiversityCategories.description: Despite the harsh conditions, Djibouti supports a surprising variety of drought-resistant plants, including acacia trees and succulents.

statistics.details: Acacia trees are a dominant feature of the Djibouti landscape.

activities.title: Activities in Djibouti
activities.description: Djibouti offers a range of activities for adventure seekers and nature enthusiasts, from exploring its unique landscapes to experiencing its rich culture.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore the rugged mountains and volcanic plateaus of Djibouti on foot.

activities.name: Mount Haggar Ascent
activities.description: A challenging trek to the summit of Mount Haggar, offering stunning views of the surrounding landscape.
activities.requirements: Sturdy hiking boots, water, sunscreen, hat

activities.name: Markha National Park Trails
activities.description: Explore the diverse trails of Markha National Park, discovering its unique flora and fauna.

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy the warm waters of the Indian Ocean with a variety of water sports activities.

activities.name: Diving and Snorkeling
activities.description: Explore the vibrant coral reefs and marine life of Djibouti's coastline.

activities.name: Coastal Walks
activities.description: Take a leisurely stroll along Djibouti's pristine beaches.

clothing.summer: Lightweight, breathable clothing, swimwear, hat, sunglasses

equipment.hiking: Hiking boots, trekking poles, map, compass
